cs.man.ac.uk.data

Class GaussianEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.data.GaussianEstimator

  • public class GaussianEstimator
extends java.lang.Object
    Gaussian incremental estimator that uses incremental method that is more resistant to floating point imprecision. For more info see Donald Knuth's "The Art of Computer Programming, Volume 2: Seminumerical Algorithms", section 4.2.2. This is basically used to model feature distributions within our algorithm.
    Author:
    Richard Kirkby (rkirkby@cs.waikato.ac.nz), Rob Lyon

      • addObservation

        public void addObservation(double value,
                           double weight)
        Updates the Gaussian model using an observed example.
        Parameters:
        value - the double value of the example.
        weight - the weight associated with the example, will always be 1.0 unless some sort of cost sensitive learning approach is used.

      • probabilityDensity

      • estimatedWeight_LessThan_EqualTo_GreaterThan_Value

        public double[] estimatedWeight_LessThan_EqualTo_GreaterThan_Value(double value)
        Returns an estimate of the weight of examples equal to a specific value, less than a specific value, and greater than a specific value. For example, imagine that 10% of examples have the value 5, and that there have been 500 examples observed. Assuming a weight of 1.0 per example, then the weight of examples with the value of 5 = 10% of (1.0 * 500) = 50. If 80% of values are below 5, then the weight less than 5 = 80% of(1.0 * 500) = 400, and thus the weight of examples greater than 5 must be 50. This information is useful for computing split points in the tree.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to estimate the weights for.
        Returns:
        an array of doubles containing the lessThanWeight, equalToWeight, and greaterThanWeight in that order.
